Reason: The configuration option 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb' is performance-sensitive. This is because the code snippet related to this configuration involves a file system sync operation based on the current position in the file. The frequency of triggering the sync operation is directly determined by the value of 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb'. A smaller interval value will lead to more frequent sync operations, impacting system performance. On the other hand, a larger interval value may improve performance but potentially compromise data durability.
